intro: Markhamia pierrei, commonly known as the Natal lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces upright, tubular flower stalks. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Markhamia pierrei is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
